resources

Class FileRetriever

  • java.lang.Object
    • resources.FileRetriever

  • public class FileRetriever
extends java.lang.Object
    FileRetrievers retrieve files from the game storage folder.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileRetriever()
      Creates a new FileRetriever for files within the current jar.
      FileRetriever(java.lang.String folderLocation)
      Creates a new FileRetriever.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.io.File retrieveFile(java.lang.String fileName)
      Either retrieves a file from the game storage folder or from the current jar, depending on which constructor was used.
      java.awt.Image retrieveImage(java.lang.String fileName)
      Either retrieves an image from the game storage folder or from the current jar, depending on which constructor was used.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileRetriever

        public FileRetriever()
        Creates a new FileRetriever for files within the current jar.

      • FileRetriever

        public FileRetriever(java.lang.String folderLocation)
        Creates a new FileRetriever.
        Parameters:
        folderLocation - Location of the game storage folder.

    • Method Detail

      • retrieveFile

        public java.io.File retrieveFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Either retrieves a file from the game storage folder or from the current jar, depending on which constructor was used. Creates a file if none matching the provided file name exist.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the target file with the filetype extension included. Example: res\\example.png for a file in a folder res/example.png for a file in the res package in your program
        Returns:
        The target file.

      • retrieveImage

        public java.awt.Image retrieveImage(java.lang.String fileName)
        Either retrieves an image from the game storage folder or from the current jar, depending on which constructor was used.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the target image with the filetype extension included. Example: res\\example.png for an image in a folder res/example.png for an image in the res package in your program
        Returns:
        The target image.
